department.dept_long_name: Department of Earth and Planetary Sciences

course.title: Earth Resources and the Environment
course.meeting_text: Tu., Th., 1-2:30, three hours of laboratory work each week and three field trips
course.description: An overview of the Earth's energy and material resources. Following introductions to hydrocarbons, nuclear fuels, and other economically important ores, the course emphasizes methods used to exploit these resources and the environmental impacts of these operations. Topics include: coal and acid rain; petroleum, photochemical smog, and oil spills; nuclear power and radioactive hazards; alternative energies; metals and mining. Labs emphasize methods for discovering and exploiting resources, as well as environmental remediation approaches.
course.prerequisites: EPS 21, ES 6, or equivalent courses and permission of the instructor.
course.notes: Given in alternate years. This course, when taken for a letter grade, meets the General Education requirement for Science of the Physical Universe.
